newsitem.title: AUSTRALIA: RTRS-Australia pension fund returns fall in Nov yr.
newsitem.headline: RTRS-Australia pension fund returns fall in Nov yr.

text.p: Market-linked Australian pooled superannuation (pension) funds reported an average return of 12 percent in the year to November 30, 1996, the latest InTech Performance Survey Superannuation Pooled Funds said.
The research group said this return showed a decline of 1.5 percent from the year to October 1996.
InTech said Australian shares returned 15.2 percent for the November 1996 year, as measured by the Australian Stock Exchnage (ASX) All Ordinaries Accumulation Index.
This represents a decrease of three percent from the strong year to October figure of 18.2 percent.

"Once again the leading asset class over the year, offshore shares, returned 21.8 percent in local currency terms and 8.3 percent on an unhedged basis (as measured by the Morgan Stanley Capital International (MSCI) World ex-Australia Index), it said.
International bonds, on a fully hedged basis gained 12.1 percent, as measured by the Salomon Brothers World Government Bond ex-Australia Index, InTech said.

Australian bonds gained 12.4 percent, as measured by the Commonwealth Bank All Series All Maturities Accumulation Index, over the year. This reflected a decrease on last month's year figure of 14.7 percent, it said.

Listed property trusts returned 18.9 percent, as measured by the ASX Property Trusts Accumulation Index, to become the highest returning major domestic asset class for the year to November 1996, InTech said.

InTech said the best performing market-linked funds for the year to November were BNP 19.0 percent, Hambros Hopkins 16.9 percent, Portfolio Partners 15.2 percent, Maple-Brown Abbott 14.8 percent and GIO 14.0 percent.
It said the best performing capital stable funds were SMF 11.5 percent, BTA 11.2 percent, Prudential 11.1 percent and Mercantile Mutual 11.0 percent. --Sydney newsroom 61-2 9373-1800
